columns.text: For this problem, we are tasked to solve for the DOL at the given level of output.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{DOL}&=1+\dfrac{\$235,000}{\$444,937.50}\\[15 pt]
&=1.53
\end{aligned}$$

The DOL at the given output level is $1.53$

With the given values in the previous exercise, the accounting break-even point is at:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Q}&=\dfrac{\$235,000+\$143,750}{\$29-\$19}\\[15 pt]
&=37,875
\end{aligned}$$

Now, we need to get the OCF at the accounting break-even point using this formula:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{OCF}_\text{accounting break-even}&=[(P−v)×Q−FC]×(1−T)+(T×D)\\
&=[(\$29-\$19) \times 37,785-\$235,000]\\
&\times(1-0.21)+(0.21\times \$143,750)\\
&=\$142,850\times 0.79+(\$30,187.50)\\
&=\$143,039
\end{aligned}$$

Substituting the values, we will get:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{OCF}_\text{accounting break-even}&=[(\$29-\$19) \times 37,785-\$235,000]\\
&\times(1-0.21)+(0.21\times \$143,750)\\[15 pt]
&=\$142,850\times 0.79+(\$30,187.50)\\[15 pt]
&=\$143,039
\end{aligned}$$

Now that we have the OCF at the accounting break-even point, we can solve for the DOL using the formula in Step 1:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{DOL}&=1+\dfrac{\$235,000}{\$143,039}\\
&=2.64
\end{aligned}$$

The DOL at the accounting break-even point is $2.64$
